title: Windows 10 anniversary update bugsplat
body: Hello. It's been more than a month now that I can't play LoL. My pc forced the Windows 10 Anniversary Update and I can't get into the game without geting a bugsplat.You get into champion select but can't get into the loading screen. I've seen a few posts about it in NA forums with the only solution to be to rollback your pc before the update, which is now not an option since you can only uninstall that update within 10 days. That time has long past and still no solution to this problem and I have sent countless bugsplat reports. Please don't post the bugsplat guide as a solution cause none of what it mentions is the problem. I double checked everything there and the problem persists.

replies.body: Bugsplats are commonly due to outdated driver issues or bad game files, which can certainly happen after a big OS update like that.  I suggest going over each step of our [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to make sure everything is configured and working properly.  Even if it doesn't mention the problem doesn't mean it won't have the tools necessary fix this up.  Please go over them to rule out possibilities and resolve this for good.  The choice is entirely up to you of course!

I have been having the same issue.  I have done everything recommended by the forums and the guide, including installs and even trying on another machine that has the same Win10 update.  No luck.  The guide is not working for this particular issue.  Is there another solution Riot has come up with for this?

If you are continuing to recieve bugspalts after completing each step in the bugsplat guide, then reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Grab some logs for context through our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), and our tech team can help out individually.  We'll reply as soon as possible!
Thanks was about to say I've done every step :<

This is what I got about bugsplat after champ select from tech support, also said to temporarily uninstall  anti-virus programs,
 ) These issues can be caused by a recent Windows 10 Anniversary update. This update made some changes to the Xbox service and enabled " DVR (game recording)" by default. Whether or not players have used this in the past, it would be in their best interest to double check that this is turned off. To turn off the Game DVR feature in the Windows 10, please do the following:

Open the Xbox app by going to the Search bar on the bottom left of the screen and typing "Xbox"
Click on the Settings (Gear) icon on the left.
Click on Game DVR at the top.
Click on the On/Off (switch) under "Record game clips and screenshots using Game DVR" to turn it off. (it should be gray and set to "Off")
Thank you. Someone already posted a link to a post that is about the same solution. I have already solved it but ty for your answer anyway. Indeed it was the xbox bar causing the issue.
